meanings.definition: Extraneous or unnecessary ornamentation or decoration.
meanings.sent1: The dress was simple, without any frills or fancy decorations.
meanings.sent2: She loved the frills on the curtains, they added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The cake was covered in so many frills, it looked like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was full of frills, making it hard to understand the main point.
meanings.sent5: The frills on the gift wrap made it stand out among the others.

meanings.definition: A ruffle or gathered strip of fabric used for decoration.
meanings.sent1: The little girl's dress had frills at the hem, making it look adorable.
meanings.sent2: She sewed delicate frills onto the pillowcases to give them a fancy look.
meanings.sent3: The frills on the costume made the actor look like a princess from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: The frills on the tablecloth danced in the breeze, creating a festive atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The frills on the baby's bonnet made everyone smile with their cuteness.

meanings.definition: To add unnecessary details or embellishments.
meanings.sent1: He tends to frills his stories with made-up details to make them more interesting.
meanings.sent2: The designer decided to frills the dress with sequins and beads for a glamorous look.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't resist frills her essay with flowery language, even though it was unnecessary.
meanings.sent4: The chef liked to frills his dishes with exotic spices to impress the diners.
meanings.sent5: The artist chose to frills the painting with splashes of vibrant colors for a striking effect.
